comment.text: The "RTL interface" translation key is used to display a tooltip title when using RTL (Right-to-Left) interfaces. It appears in various components, including info badges, and needs to be translated for languages that use this writing direction.

usage.context:
<InfoBadge
 offset={offset}
 place={isMobile ? mobilePlace : place}
 label={t("Common:BetaLabel")}
 tooltipDescription={tooltipDescription}
 tooltipTitle={t("Common:BetaBadgeTitle")}
 />
 );
 };
 
 export { BetaBadge, BetaBadgeProps };

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Arabic translation 'واجهة مكتوبة من اليمين إلى اليسار' literally translates to 'interface written from right to left'. While technically correct, it doesn't convey the meaning of 'RTL interface' which refers to a user interface design direction. The Arabic translation doesn't reflect this meaning. A more appropriate translation would describe the RTL property of the interface.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: واجهة انعكاس (wa'jhat in'ikaas) - This translates to 'mirrored interface' or 'reflected interface', which better captures the RTL meaning. Alternatively, 'واجهة للقراءة من اليمين إلى اليسار' (wa'jhat lil-qira'a min al-yameen ila al-yasaar) - 'interface for reading from right to left' is also acceptable.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The French translation "Interface RTL" is a literal translation and may not be the most natural or accurate way to express "RTL interface" in French. While understandable, it lacks fluency. A better translation might be 'Interface RTL' or 'Interface en RTL'.
The translation 'Interface RTL' is a literal translation and doesn't flow naturally in Portuguese. While understandable, it's not the standard way to refer to an RTL interface.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider a more natural translation like 'Interface para Direção da Esquerda para a Direita' or simply 'Interface RTL' if brevity is crucial and the context is already understood.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "nterface RTL" appears to have a typo and doesn't accurately translate "RTL interface". It's missing the word 'interface' at the beginning and has a typo in the word 'interface'. Also, 'RTL' is an abbreviation and should ideally remain as is, unless a specific localization requirement dictates otherwise.

The translation "Interfață cu scriere/citire de la dreapta la stânga" is overly literal and doesn't accurately convey the meaning of "RTL interface". An RTL interface refers to an interface designed for right-to-left languages. A better translation would focus on that functionality.
The use of a full phrase is verbose for a title. A shorter, more direct translation would be preferable for a badge title.

The translation "Интерфейс RTL" is a literal translation but might not be the most natural or idiomatic way to express 'RTL interface' in Russian. Depending on the context, a more suitable translation might be 'RTL-интерфейс' (RTL hyphenated) or a more descriptive phrase.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider 'RTL-интерфейс' or a more context-specific translation for 'RTL interface'.
